reviews.text: Hotel/Casino were very nice, room was beautiful, new pool area (bar,pool outside sunning area) was quite impressive. The only negatives were the limited food options. The buffet closed at 9pm, and wasn't open during the week for breakfast. How disappointing! The other 2 small "delis" always had lines which was upsetting when just trying to get a cup of coffee or snack.
reviews.title: Needs more food options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here on a Sunday night for a birthday present for my husband. We took the bus from Manhattan ($31 a person, round trip), where we had to get off at ceaser's. Pro: The bus company gives each person a ticket for $20 - cash! - if you have or get a rewards card with the hotel (which is owned by Harrha's and has many benefits, well worth getting the card). Con: there is a shuttle bus that takes people from the Harrahs hotels (bally's, ceaser's, showboat and harrah's) for free if you are a rewards member, but if you aren't an upper tier member you have to be checked in to get the free shuttle. Since we couldnt check in until we actually GOT to harrah's, we were stranded at Ceasers being offered $13 cab rides to go only 2 miles. Take the jitney for $2 a person.
reviews.title: Large, wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Total Rewards card got us the $20 a person, the free shuttle (once we finally got there), and is the basis for comps, etc. We also went to Harrahs.com before and signed up for their newsletter, which gave us a coupon for a free drink at their large bar on the casino floor (with the card). Also free parking with the card. Well worth it.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay At Harrah's--Pool Is Beautiful

likes.liked: — Temp in room was cool; Pool was beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we finally get the hotel - it is HUGE. It reminded me of a brand new cruise ship. It had everything you could every need without leaving the air conditioning. Check in was about 5 minutes, and easy. I paid $279 (this IS high season) for a package that included a bay/city view, 2 buffets (which are normally $30 a piece), and 2 tickets to the Movin' Out show (don't bother unless you LOVE dance theatre). A very good deal with the buffets included.
reviews.title: Very pleased with Harrah's!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large, with a desk, king bed, large dresser/tv armoire, couch, coffee table, sitting chair, etc etc. No complaints about the room at all. Very cold (like I like it) and in the Marina Tower.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Staff unprofessional and inconsistant, Casino layout confusing

reviews.text: We booked a room for 3 nights (7/29-7/31). The first 2 times, the directions were confusing but we got in from there. Upon check-in, we only waited about 5 minutes and started the process. We ordered a harbor tower room but we asked for the bayview, that being the newest tower in Harrah's. He told us that they really reserve that for the platinum and diamond members and hes not allowed to do this but he somehow gave it to us under somebody's name or something and told us we couldn't use any room service and that type of stuff which was just fine with us.
reviews.title: Very nice and luxury.

likes.disliked: — the age rules on the new pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 18th floor of the bayview tower. When we walked in the room, it was just breathtaking. We were very excited about the accommodation and luxury of the room. Everything was very clean. Even though Harrah's is not on the boardwalk, it is not even comparable to the other casinos. Its definetly worth some 10 minutes on the rode. I must warn you, if you are traveling with kids as i was, beware that the new pool they feature is only for people above 21 years of age, not 20 but 21. Pretty insane as we were upset and had to go to the stupid and old harbor tower pool. Other then that, what Harrah's did with the place, is fantastic and the buffet is a must also.
reviews.title: Pleased with Harrah's and its Pool

reviews.text: Check out my pics.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Harrah’s for one night on July 29, 2007. We stayed in room 411 in the Harbor Tower. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Not one complaint

reviews.text: Our stay did not start off well at all. Our bus from NYC had pulled into Caesar’s and I was anticipating taking the free shuttle bus for guests to Harrah’s. After presenting the driver with my Rewards card and my itinerary I boarded the shuttle, but the driver said a direct bus to Harrah’s would be arriving in 5 minutes. We got off the bus and the next shuttle driver, Debby, absolutely refused to let us get on the bus even though I had an itinerary and Rewards card and the previous driver let us on with no problem. She said I needed some sort of slip that I would obtain upon checking in, but we had not checked in yet! We then had to vacate the Caesar’s premises and pay to take a jitney to Harrah’s.
reviews.title: My way at Harrah's
Not a great hotel but I like the casino and Eden
reviews.text: I had been to the casino once and won money and enjoyed a Springsteen tribute band at the bar (I think it's called the Eden Lounge). Plus, we saw The Rat Pack is Back, which I loved. By all means that was a great night...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next time in AC, we decided to stay at Harrah's. First off, there were less than 10 people in line ahead of us and we waited for almost an HOUR!!!
reviews.title: Harrah's- take it or leave it

likes.disliked: — the lack of free tv viewing channels

reviews.text: We were given a harbour room which was good sized, but could definately use a new bad (the springs on the mattress were very evident and uncomfortable). Oh...and the bathroom was terrible...completely dark. I later found out that there were newer tower rooms which seems nicer and more modern. Now, I know...
reviews.title: Fun for families

likes.liked: — They are very family-friendly and kid-friendly
likes.disliked: — needs more shopping within the hotel

reviews.text: Harrah's has Kiosk's set up where you swipe your card to redeem your bonus points. I don't like this at all. At The Borgata, for example, your comps go to your card automatically. Harrah's makes you wait in line at the kiosk, so you can print out a voucher and then have to wait in line at the cashier. Seems to be a slow moving place in general...
reviews.title: Great Hotel And Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lost lots of money on the casino floor this time around. :( But, I'm not new to gambling, so I've come to expect that you win some, lose some... Just watch the trips to the ATM!
reviews.title: Great Place for a winter stay

reviews.text: stayed in the harbour tower. room was comped because I entered the poker tournment as a diamond player. check in is a breeze, because as diamond player, you dont wait in any lines, which also includes any restaurants. the room was on the 8th floor, and there was a low buzzing sound coming in from the heat exchangers outside, and the flood lites that lite up the side on the building so you can see it off in the distance were right below my window. bed was comfortable, clean linens -bath was well stocked although I didnt care for the pillows. the signage to get to harrahs is a little confusing as is getting back to rt. 30 upon exiting the garage, so pay attention-you make a wrong turn, and you might end up in brigantine. decent place overall, and close to the action and even better when you hit the 3-card poker table for 1200!!!!
reviews.title: acceptable
Return trip to Harrah's
reviews.text: Just returned from spending two nights at Harrah's in Atlantic City. The check-in was very efficient. My husband and I were assigned a very adequate room in the requested Harbor Tower. We had been away from Harrah's about 2 years as we didn't like their restaurant facilities. We had heard that the Deli had returned and we were very anxious to try it out. However, when we arrived we found that the new Deli is a cafeteria style restaurant and not like their previous one with waitresses. We didn't even sample the food even though it looked enticing.

One of the irritants of our visit was the service we received because we were only GOLD card members. On two occasions I was denied service at the so called "Diamond Express" window even though the employee was doing nothing but staring into space. I was advised to go around the corner to another window and wait on line. My husband who is disabled and uses a cane was denied service on 3 occasions. This treatment is very demeaning and I am writing to management of the hotel and spelling out our displeasure.
reviews.title: Harrahs was nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In conversations with several dealers regarding the Smoking Ban, all advised me that they would not volunteer to work in the "Smoking Section" so we believe management will have to offer some incentive for workers to participate in the "foggy and unhealthy" room.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we believe when it comes to customer service, Harrah's has room for much improvement.
reviews.title: Couldn't sleep AT ALL. And no sympathy from the staff.
